abstract: Deals involving special-purpose acquisition corporations that sat on cash and safe investments outperformed those that did deals.
snippet: Deals involving special-purpose acquisition corporations that sat on cash and safe investments outperformed those that did deals.
lead_paragraph: The alphabet soup of investments that Wall Street cooked up during the boom  M.B.S.’s., C.D.O.’s, SIVs and the like  included yet another obscure financial ingredient: things called SPACs.

byline.original: By Lauren Silva Laughlin and George Hay

abstract: Watchitoo wants to duplicate the camaraderie of watching TV through technology that allows friends to view Web video and talk about it through a common browser window.
snippet: Watchitoo wants to duplicate the camaraderie of watching TV through technology that allows friends to view Web video and talk about it through a common browser window.
lead_paragraph: After I moved to the East Coast a few months ago, a few of my close friends and I became fans of video chatting via Google to keep in touch.

headline.main: Hey, Gang, Let’s Watch the Web Together

abstract: Blank-check companies that returned investors’ money after failing to find acquisitions generally performed better than those that actually made deals, Breakingviews finds.
snippet: Blank-check companies that returned investors’ money after failing to find acquisitions generally performed better than those that actually made deals, Breakingviews finds.
lead_paragraph: The alphabet soup of investments that Wall Street cooked up during the boom — M.B.S.’s., C.D.O.’s, SIVs and the like — included yet another obscure financial ingredient: things called SPACs. SPAC stands for special-purpose acquisition corporations, or blank check companies. These shell companies went public and promised to use investors’ money to make acquisitions.
